Issues.Title: WIP - fix(ivy): mark view as dirty by default when events fire
Issues.Body:
In Ivy, we support a new manual mode that allows for stricter control
over change detection in OnPush components. Specifically, in this mode,
events do not automatically mark OnPush views as dirty. Only changed
inputs and manual calls to `markDirty()` actually mark a view dirty.

However, this mode cannot be the default for OnPush components if we
want to be backwards compatible with View Engine. This commit re-adds
the legacy logic for OnPush components where events always mark views
dirty and makes it the default behavior.

Note: It is still TODO to add a public API for manual change detection.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "WIP - fix(ivy): mark view as dirty by default when events fire" (#28462)

Issues.Title: fix(bazel): fix integration test for bazel-schematics
Issues.Body:
With the release of @angular/bazel v7.2.3, the npm install step right
after `ng new` installs this version. However there is a bug in the
builder which results in bazel executable not found.

This bug was not discovered before because the dependencies of the
project created by `ng new` are not pinned.

The fix is to pin the version of @angular/bazel to 7.2.2 which relies on
global installation of bazel. This serves to unblock the broken CI. A proper
fix will be submitted in a follow-up PR.

This makes the API cleaner by explicitly passing it ont `createLView`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(ivy): pass host into createLView explicitly" (#28461)

Issues.Title: ci: fix symbol test to handle duplicate symbols
Issues.Body:
In 7cb8396, we improved the symbol test to remove suffixes from
the output, so "CIRCULAR$1" became "CIRCULAR". However, the logic
that checked for extra symbols depended on each symbol being unique.
If multiple symbols with the same name were added (e.g. pulled in
from separate files), they would be added to the map as "extras",
even if they were marked as expected in the golden file.

This commit updates the symbol checking logic to take multiple
symbols with the same name into account.

Closes #28406
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ci: fix symbol test to handle duplicate symbols" (#28459)

Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
This feature request is for @angular/compiler

### Description
Allow setting the ElementSchemaRegistry for the AOT compiler.

At the moment we can configure a custom ElementSchemaRegistry for JIT using the bootstrap parameter compilerOptions configuring a static provider overwriting the ElementSchemaRegistry provider:
```
bootstrapModule<M>(moduleType: Type<M>, compilerOptions?: (CompilerOptions & BootstrapOptions) | Array<CompilerOptions & BootstrapOptions>): Promise<NgModuleRef<M>>;

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): remove DOM nodes from their real parent vs saved parent
Issues.Body:
Currently, DOM node removal called `removeChild` on the saved parent
node when destroying a component. However, this will fail if the
component has been manually moved in the DOM. This change makes the
removal always use the node's real `parentNode` and ignore the provided
`parent`.

Reference: FW-977
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): remove DOM nodes from their real parent vs saved parent" (#28455)

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/common/http


### Description
The type definition for HttpParamsOptions fromObject property only accepts string and string[].  If using immutable types, such as ReadonlyArray, you must create a new array unnecessarily to satisfy the type.


### Describe the solution you'd like
Please change the type to the following (which is backwards compatible):

```
    fromObject?: {
        [param: string]: string | string[] | ReadonlyArray<string>;
    };
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HttpParams fromObject should accept ReadonlyArray<string>" (#28452)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): proper component resolution in case of inheritance
Issues.Body:
Ivy allows Components to extend Directives (but not the other way around) and as a result we may have Component and Directive annotations present at the same time. The logic that resolves annotations to pick the necessary one didn't take this into account and as a result Components were recognized as Directives (and vice versa) in case of inheritance. This change updates the resolution logic by picking known annotation that is the nearest one (in inheritance tree) and compares it with expected type. That should help avoid mis-classification of Components/Directives during resolution.

This PR resolves FW-966 and unblocks a portion of Material tests (related to Stepper component) to run under Ivy.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): proper component resolution in case of inheritance" (#28439)

Issues.Title: refactor(bazel): Create `ng-add` schematic for Bazel
Issues.Body:
The logic to create additional files needed for Bazel are currently
hosted in `ng new`. Such files include the `main.*.ts` files needed
for AOT and a different `angular.json` to use Bazel builder, among others.

This commit refactors the logic into `ng add` so that it can be used to
perform the same modifications in an existing project. Users could do so
by running `ng add @angular/bazel`.

With this change, `ng new` effectively becomes an orchestrator that runs
the original `ng new` followed by `ng add @angular/bazel`.

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): provide a TS-like path to ngProgram.listLazyRo‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶utes

The webpack plugin was leaking our internal Path abstraction to the Angular compiler via the `ngProgram.listLazyRoutes` call.

This Path abstraction is provided by `@angular-devkit/core` and shouldn't leak. Instead a TS-like path should be provided to the Angular program.

Fix #13531

Issues.Title: ngtools: `listLazyRoutes()` called with `entryRoute` normalized in non-standard way
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] build
- [x] serve
```


### Is this a regression?

N/A


### Description

When ngtools callls [ngProgram.listLazyRoutes()][1] it may optionally pass an `entryRoute`. This route is based on [entryModule.path][2], which is in turn [resolved from `_mainPath`][3], which is in turn [resolved][4] by the [custom compiler host][5], which [normalizes paths][6] in a [proprietary way][7] (e.g. converting Windows paths like this: `C:\foo\bar` --> `/C/foo/bar`).

This is different than how, for example, TS normalizes Windows paths (i.e. `C:\foo\bar` --> `C:/foo/bar`), which means that `listLazyRoutes()` implementations need to be aware of the cli normalization logic and perform similar normalization when trying to match `entryRoute` with their available routes.

[1]: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/7347d881925130ce325009588b20d5b39ac73258/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/angular_compiler_plugin.ts#L465
[2]: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/7347d881925130ce325009588b20d5b39ac73258/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/angular_compiler_plugin.ts#L457
[3]: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/7347d881925130ce325009588b20d5b39ac73258/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/angular_compiler_plugin.ts#L411-L412
[4]: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/7347d881925130ce325009588b20d5b39ac73258/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/angular_compiler_plugin.ts#L682
[5]: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/7347d881925130ce325009588b20d5b39ac73258/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/angular_compiler_plugin.ts#L660-L666
[6]: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/7347d881925130ce325009588b20d5b39ac73258/packages/ngtools/webpack/src/compiler_host.ts#L65-L66
[7]: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/7347d881925130ce325009588b20d5b39ac73258/packages/angular_devkit/core/src/virtual-fs/path.ts#L232-L284


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Issues that don't have enough info and can't be reproduced will be closed.

You can read more about issue submission guidelines here: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#-submitting-an-issue
-->


## üåç Your Environment
```
Angular CLI: 7.3.0-rc.0
Node: 10.15.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 8.0.0-beta.1+28.sha-e2c98fb
... animations, common, compiler, core, forms, language-service

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): ng-add should resolve package.json
Issues.Body:
`ng-add` checks if a specified collection is installed, and if not it'd
proceed to install the package. However, `isPackageInstalled()` would, by
default, resolve the main field or the index of the package. Not all NPM
packages specify the main field or provide an index file. It should
be sufficient to just check the presence of `package.json` to detect
whether a package is installed or not.

For example, `ng add @angular/bazel` should not install the package if
it's already installed locally. `@angular/bazel` does not specify a main
field nor an index file in its `package.json`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): ng-add should resolve package.json" (#13536)

Issues.Title: Schematics options camelCase coercion
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
- [x] schematics
```

### Description
When passing arguments to `schematics` as options, I would like to be able to pass a dash-case option (i.e. `---dry-run`) and get the camelCase equivalent (i.e. `dryRun`) in the options passed to my schematic.

Currently, if I pass the option `option-one` as a dash-case argument...
```bash
schematics my-collection:my-schematic --option-one=test
```
The factory function will receive the following options object...
```json
{
    "option-one": "test"
}
```

Furthermore, if I were to pass both the dash-case and camelCase equivalent of the same argument like so...
```bash
schematics my-collection:my-schematic --option-one=test1 --optionOne=test2
```
The factory function will receive the following options object...
```json
{
    "option-one": "test1",
    "optionOne": "test2"
}
```

This is not only very confusing but also inconsistent with the base schematics options such as `--dry-run`. Meaning that the following two commands are analogous...

```bash
schematics my-collection:my-schematic --dry-run=true
schematics my-collection:my-schematic --dryRun=true
```
Thereby treating `dry-run` as `dryRun`. I don't see a great use case for allowing two arguments of different cases to coexist.

### Describe the solution you'd like
#### Option 1
Coerce all options argument to camelCase.

#### Option 2
Smart case corecursion of all options argument based on options schema.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Checking for both dash-case and camelCase options and resolving each option manually based on expected options schema.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Schematics options camelCase coercion" (#13544)

Issues.Title: Enable building with source maps generated as inline-source-map
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
Enable configure angular-cli to create inline source maps.
The problem is that it is not possible to debug hybrid/cordova based apps built with angular on android devices. The reason is that Chrome debugger cannot access the source map file on the device. The solution/fix is to include the source map inline

For example, here is one of the issue related to this https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/6674
The temporary hack described [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52499545/how-to-configure-angular-cli-to-create-inline-sourcemaps/53850796#53850796) however it would be very helpful to be able to configure angular cli using standard methods to generate inline source maps.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
As I understand (based on @angular-devkit/build-angular) angular cli either uses eval or source-map as a webpack devtool option (https://webpack.js.org/configuration/devtool/). There is no standard way to use a different devtool option for source maps generated.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
Add devtool or similar build option (smth like deprecated evalSourceMap build option but allowing to set any supported webpack devtool option)

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
Options 1) The temporary hack described [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52499545/how-to-configure-angular-cli-to-create-inline-sourcemaps/53850796#53850796)
Option 2) Use custom tools to extend the Angular CLI build behaviour, for example https://github.com/manfredsteyer/ngx-build-plus
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue " Enable building with source maps generated as inline-source-map" (#13543)

Issues.Title: ng test does not react properly when detecting a code change
Issues.Body:
As requested by @filipesilva, I tested this issue again on a newer CLI version: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/9901

The result is that the bug is exactly the same as before. As described in the original issue.

I post here my new `ng --version` as well as the (same) description of the bug.

### Versions
```
Angular CLI: 7.2.3
Node: 10.15.0
OS: linux x64
Angular: 7.2.2
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.12.3
@angular-devkit/core              7.2.3
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.2.3
@angular/cli                      7.2.3
@ngtools/webpack                  7.2.3
@schematics/angular               7.2.3
@schematics/update                0.12.3
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.28.4

```

### Repro steps
* Setup an Angular app with many unit test cases
* Run your unit tests
* While they are running, change a file and force to run a single case set to run (by using `fdescribe` or `fit`) 


### Observed behavior

It will recompile (or at least it looks like it) but it will still keep continuing the previous run instead of starting a new one with the specific test cases set.

So every time I need to use `fdescribe` or `fit` I need either to wait that the current test run finishes or I have to manually kill and restart `ng test

### Desired behavior

Whenever something changes in the code, `ng test` should just recompile and rerun again from the beginning and taking into account any changes related to the test cases set to run (e.g. any usage of `fdescribe` or `fit` should be taken into account without the need of restarting the cli process)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng test does not react properly when detecting a code change" (#13542)

Issues.Title: Can't resolve '@ngtools/webpack' in yarn monorepo
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No. (Perhaps in a really old version before migrating to the monorepo structure, see more in description) ### Description During the build process (on `build`, `serve` or `test`) an error occurs (see below) and the build fails. The `@ngtools/webpack` package can not be resolved. This happens due to a yarn monorepo structure, in which `@ngtools/webpack` will not be placed in the root `./node_modules` folder due conflicts with other dependencies, so it gets placed under `./node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/node_modules`. And then it can not be found during build. I tracked down the issue and found the source. You can see the problem also in issue #10220. It was fixed by @hansl in the old single repo: https://github.com/angular/devkit/pull/647 but didn't get copied to the new monorepo? --> https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/typescript.ts#L23 **Can we do this change once again?** If I change those lines locally the build is successful, but I do not know if we can simply change this without other problems? Note: If you have a monorepo with only one angular application this problem should not happen, but in my case the monorepo has also some angularjs applications and multiple webpack configurations. So multiple webpack, loader and angular dependency versions are around, not all aligned. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Reproduction repo: https://github.com/fabianbru/angular-cli-bug-reproduction This repo is a striped down repo, so there are many dependencies without real code. Step-by-Step guide: - Node 10 (Node version should not matter) - yarn 1.13.0 - Checkout - run `yarn` in the root to install all dependencies - run `yarn dev` in the root --> ERROR will occur - change lines 7-9 locally in `node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/typescript.js` to: ``` const webpackLoader = require.resolve('@ngtools/webpack') ``` ---> build should be successful ## üî• Exception or Error 


ERROR in multi /angular-cli-bug-reproduction/node_modules/webpack-dev-server/client?http://0.0.0.0:0 webpack/hot/dev-server ./src/main.ts
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@ngtools/webpack' in '/angular-cli-bug-reproduction/packages/angular'
ERROR in multi ./src/polyfills.ts
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@ngtools/webpack' in '/angular-cli-bug-reproduction/packages/angular'

 is the path to my workspace, like `/Users/xyz/workspace`
## üåç Your Environment 


Angular CLI: 7.2.3
Node: 10.15.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.2
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, material, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.12.3
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.12.3
@angular-devkit/core              7.2.3
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.2.3
@angular/cli                      7.2.3
@angular/flex-layout              7.0.0-beta.23
@schematics/angular               7.2.3
@schematics/update                0.12.3
rxjs                              6.3.3
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.29.0
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: [meta] New releases should post notifications in resolved issues/merged PRs
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
When a new release is published, it includes information in the changelog about which PRs are included and which issues are fixed in the new version.  The publishing process should include automated notification hooks so that those following the issues/PRs will see the message and know that it's resolved.

I'm making an issue for this per [this comment](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/13212#issuecomment-457889697) from @IgorMinar.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[meta] New releases should post notifications in resolved issues/merged PRs" (#13530)

Issues.Title: NodePackageInstallTask does not resolve absolute paths
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [x] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Description I use `@angular-devkit/schematics` as a dependency in a custom CLI. I observed that when a `NodePackageInstallTask` is used within a `NodeWorkflow` where the root directory has not been provided, the working directory in `new NodePackageInstallTask("/path/to/directory")` is not resolved correctly and ends up with a `ENOENT` error. It seems to be related to the `NodeWorkflow` class: - In the constructor, [the `root` parameter is optional](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/schematics/tools/workflow/node-workflow.ts#L25) - then there is [this fallback](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/schematics/tools/workflow/node-workflow.ts#L45) returning undefined. - the node package executor fallbacks on [`process.cwd()`](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/schematics/tasks/node-package/executor.ts#L60) as root directory which is [then prepended to the working directory](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/schematics/tasks/node-package/executor.ts#L78). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` import { NodeJsSyncHost } from '@angular-devkit/core/node'; import { NodeWorkflow } from '@angular-devkit/schematics/tools'; const fsHost = new virtualFs.ScopedHost(new NodeJsSyncHost()); const workflow = new NodeWorkflow(fsHost, { dryRun:false }); // schematics function schematics(){ return (host: Tree, context: SchematicContext) => { const projectPath= "/home/path/to/project" const templateSource = apply(url(templatePath), [move(projectPath)]); context.addTask(new NodePackageInstallTask(projectPath)); return chain([branchAndMerge(mergeWith(templateSource))])(host, context); } } ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

events.js:167
      throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
      ^

Error: spawn /bin/sh ENOENT
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:229:19)
    at onErrorNT (internal/child_process.js:406:16)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:63:19)
    at Function.Module.runMain (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:745:11)
    at startup (internal/bootstrap/node.js:236:19)
    at bootstrapNodeJSCore (internal/bootstrap/node.js:560:3)
Emitted 'error' event at:
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (internal/child_process.js:235:12)
    at onErrorNT (internal/child_process.js:406:16)
    [... lines matching original stack trace ...]
    at bootstrapNodeJSCore (internal/bootstrap/node.js:560:3)
## üåç Your Environment 

 "@angular-devkit/core": "^7.3.0-rc.0",
 "@angular-devkit/schematics": "^7.3.0-rc.0",
  node: 10.6.0

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): enable lazy loading with ivy
Issues.Body:
Angular `8.0.0-beta.1` supports lazy loading with Ivy (at least a partial support), but currently the CLI needs `"allowEmptyCodegenFiles": true` to avoid errors like:

```
ERROR in ./src/$$_lazy_route_resource lazy namespace object
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '/src/app/races/races.module.ngfactory.js' in '/src/$$_lazy_route_resource'
```

As discussed with @gkalpak this might be a temporary workaround, but it might help users giving a try to Ivy (as the workaround is not really trivial ^^) .
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): enable lazy loading with ivy" (#13524)

Issues.Title: [mat-autocomplete] openPanel() get called unexpectedly in _handleInput
Issues.Body:
#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material-autocomplete-async-test

1. Type something short, e.g., ‚Äúw‚Äù
2. Some suggestions come up
3. Select the first one "Windstorm" and hit ENTER
4. The field is filled by "Windstorm", at the same time, autocomplete panel closed.
5. Continue typing an extra char, making it ‚ÄúWindstormd‚Äù (which shouldn't match any suggestion and hence empty panel)

#### What is the expected behavior?

No autocomplete panel shows up after I typed the extra "d".

#### What is the current behavior?

Autocomplete panel quickly shows up (showing previous matched value "Windstorm") and then closed.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

@angular/material 7.3.0, @angular/core 7.2.3. 
macOS 10.14.1

#### Is there anything else we should know?

After a deep dive, I know the root cause of this, but couldn't find a way to workaround:

Basically, what happened under the hood is as follows:
1. Type something short, e.g., ‚Äúw‚Äù
2. Some suggestions come up
3. Select the first one "Windstorm" and hit ENTER
4. The field is filled by "Windstorm", at the same time, autocomplete panel closed. What happened here are:
    1. `_handleKeydown` got called (http://bit.ly/2DKe23T)
    2. `_setValueAndClose` got called (? not 100% sure)
    3. `valueChange` of the form detected
    4. In my app, `filteredValues` updated to one single suggestion (only "Windstorm" matches)
5. Continue typing a extra char, making it ‚ÄúWindstormd‚Äù (which shouldn't match any suggestion and hence empty panel). What happened here are:
    1. `_handleInput` got called (http://bit.ly/2DM8JBf)
    2. in `_handleInput`, `this.openPanel()` get called. That's why the panel "quickly" opened, showing "previous" panel value "Windstorm"
    3. `valueChange` of the form detected
    4. In my app, `filteredValues` updated
    5. Panel closed due to empty suggestion list

I am not sure if this is the expected behavior, but this unexpected call for `openPanel()` in `_handleInput` is a bit confusing and looks weird. Are there any workaround for this?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[mat-autocomplete] openPanel() get called unexpectedly in _handleInput" (#15028)

Issues.Title: Radio button example is missing a group label
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The purpose of the group of radio buttons in the radio button example must be conveyed to users of screen reader software when a radio button in the group recieves focus.

#### What is the current behavior?
The purpose of the group of radio buttons in the radio button example is not conveyed to users of screen reader software when a radio button in the group recieves focus.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + Firefox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [table example](https://material.angular.io/components/radio/examples)
3. Navigate to one of the checkboxes in the buttons in the 'table with selection' example.
   - In NVDA you can press the tab key until you reach a radio button
   - In VoiceOver for iOS you can swipe right until you reach a radio button
4. Observe that the purpose of the group of radio buttons is not announced by the screen reader. It should be announced as something like "what is your favorite season?"

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
It is also important to point out that the group label must be visible too. In the case of this example, the text 'Your favorite season is' could be considered the group label.

https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/7556 is a related issue but isn't focused on accessibility.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Radio button example is missing a group label" (#15026)

#### What is the current behavior?

Issues.Title: fix(list): selection list not picking up indirect descendants
Issues.Body:
Fixes `MatSelectionList` not picking up list options that aren't direct descendants.

**Note:** this approach can have some side-effects if somebody decided to nest selection lists which would result in the parent picking up the options of its children. We can handle that case with some extra code, however I decided not to for now since it doesn't make sense to nest lists.

Fixes #15000.

Issues.Title: expandable row table example is not keyboard or screen reader accessible
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
1. It must be possible to expand and collapse table rows in the example by using only a keyboard
2. Roles, states, and properties must be present so that users of screen reader software are aware that the rows can expand and collapse

#### What is the current behavior?
1. It is not possible to expand and collapse table rows in the example by using only a keyboard
2. Roles, states, and properties are not provided to convey the functionality to users of screen reader software

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + Firefox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [table example page](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples)
3. Use the screen reader to navigate to a table cell in the 'Table with expandable rows' example
4. Observe that the screen reader does not convey any semantics about the current expanded state, or that it is possible to interact with the row to expand the information
5. Press the 'enter' key or space bar and obverse that the row does not expand or collapse

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?

Since rows and cells already have roles, it would be best to add a separate control to expand/collapse each row.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "expandable row table example is not keyboard or screen reader accessible" (#15020)

Issues.Title: build: fix syntax error within codeowners file
Issues.Body:
Since https://github.com/angular/material2/commit/88601fa51d581f538468a9b63890b0e285e519cb landed, it seems that the Github codeowner's are no longer working. This is because globs with such negations are not supported within the `CODEOWNERS` file

The exclusion of `.d.ts` files shouldn't be necessary anyway since the last match in the `CODEOWNERS` file takes precedence over previous matches.

Issues.Title: fix(progress-bar): clear aria-valuenow in indeterminate or query mode
Issues.Body:
Clears the `aria-valuenow` attribute when the progress bar is in indeterminate or query mode, [based on the a11y spec](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/#progressbar).

Fixes #15016.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(progress-bar): clear aria-valuenow in indeterminate or query mode" (#15019)

Issues.Title: progress-spinner: indeterminate state not correctly exposed to screen readers
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The indeterminate state of a progress spinner must be conveyed to users that are using screen reader software.

#### What is the current behavior?
Users hear something like '0%'. This does not convey an indeterminate state.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [progress spinner example](https://material.angular.io/components/progress-spinner/examples)
3. swipe right until you reach the 'indeterminate' radio button
4. double tap the screen to select the 'indeterminate' radio button
5. swipe right until you reach the progress spinner
4. Observe that the progress spinner is announced as '0%'.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The [ARIA spec states](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/#progressbar) that authors should omit the `aria-valuenow` attribute to convey the indeterminate state. The attribute is set to `aria-valuenow="50"` after switching to the indeterminate in the example.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "progress-spinner: indeterminate state not correctly exposed to screen readers" (#15018)

Issues.Title: progress bar and progress spinner examples are unreachable with NVDA and Firefox
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Someone who is using the NVDA screen reader in conjunction with Firefox should have access to the information provided by the progress bar and progress spinner components.

#### What is the current behavior?
Someone who is using the NVDA screen reader in conjunction with Firefox will not be able to access the information provided by the progress bar and process spinner components.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
##### For Progress bar
1. Using NVDA 2018.4.1 + Firefox 64
2. Open the [progress bar example](https://material.angular.io/components/progress-bar/examples)
3. Press the 'h' key until you reach the 'results' heading
4. Press the down arrow key to read the next item
4. Observe that the progress bar is not announced

##### For Progress spinner
1. Using NVDA 2018.4.1 + Firefox 64
2. Open the [progress bar example](https://material.angular.io/components/progress-spinner/examples)
3. Press the 'h' key until you reach the 'results' heading
4. Press the down arrow key to read the next item
4. Observe that the progress bar is not announced

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The progress bar and spinner can be accessed in other screen readers, including VoiceOver for iOS.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "progress bar and progress spinner examples are unreachable with NVDA and Firefox" (#15017)

Issues.Title: progress-bar: indeterminate state not correctly exposed to screen readers

Issues.Title: (bug)[Mat-Tree] - Problematic behavior when combining dynamic data with trackby
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
There should be a way to be able to dynamically update leaf nodes within a tree without forcing a collapse upon the tree.

#### What is the current behavior?
Utilizing a `trackBy` function to track an individual node by something like an ID causes the entire tree to become unresponsive after a change is made to the data. When the `trackBy` is omitted, the tree continues to respond after data changes, but any open nodes will collapse and you will have to re-navigate to the previously opened node.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Please reference the following stackblitz. Clicking the 'new' button will cause a new leaf to be created under node ID 1. Once this happens, you will see that all nodes will collapse, and clicking on the chevron will not prompt them to open. If you navigate to the template for the controller, and remove the `trackBy` function from the `mat-tree` element, you will find that upon clicking 'new' the tree will continue to collapse, but you will be able to re-expand individual nodes and see the new leaf.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-afy2h1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "(bug)[Mat-Tree] - Problematic behavior when combining dynamic data with trackby" (#15015)

Issues.Title: [MatTable], [MatSort] Sorting stops work if table has *ngIf attribute

Issues.Title: Icon example is missing alternative text
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Informative icons must convey their meaning to users of screen reader software.

#### What is the current behavior?
The informative icon in the example does not convey its meaning to users to screen reader software.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + Firefox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [icon example](https://material.angular.io/components/icon/examples)
3. Press the down arrow key to have the screen reader read the next item until you reach the icon in the "SVG icons" example.
4. Observe that the icon is not announced

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The documentation for icons states the following:

> When the presence of an icon communicates some information to the user whether as an indicator or by being inlined into a block of text, that information must also be made available to screen-readers

Because this is the only example of an icon, it should be considered to 'communicate information' as described above. Without alternative text for the icon, screen reader users will not be aware that an icon exists on the page.

It might be prudent to add examples for each of the 3 types of icons discussed in the documention: decorative, interactive, and informative.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Icon example is missing alternative text" (#15013)

Issues.Title: CDK: Add lazy-load of images
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
I would like to see fully-fledged lazy-load support for images

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
Applications need to lazy load many resources, it is a very basic need nowadays, and lazy-loading images seems to be the most typical scenario.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
By full-fledged I mean it should have the following features:

- handle img, srcset and background-images
- export directive so that other elements can link to current status (such as skeleton components could be removed when image has loaded, for instance)
- apply user-provided classes for loading and loaded states
- be compatible with SSR
- be based on IntersectionObserver
- provide clear documentation as per necessity of installing, importing IntersectionObserver (and possibly other observers) polyfills

There are a couple of libraries out there for Angular (such as `ngx-lazy-load-images` - very nice simple API), none of them delivers a complete feature set, some are no longer maintained.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CDK: Add lazy-load of images" (#15012)

Issues.Title: chips example has a keyboard trap in Firefox
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Users must be able to use the tab key on their keyboard to access to every element in the tab order on the page.

#### What is the current behavior?
Users are unable to tab past the "Chips Autocomplete" example when using Firefox.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Open Firefox 64
2. Open the [chips examples page](https://material.angular.io/components/chips/examples)
3. Press tab until you reach the chips in the "Chips with input" example (located under the "Chips Autocomplete" example)
4. Observe that it is not possible to reach the chips in the "Chips with input" example because focus is trapped to the "Chips Autocomplete" example.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- FireFox 64

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Also note this works fine in some other browsers such as Google Chrome.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "chips example has a keyboard trap in Firefox" (#15011)

Issues.Title: mat-chip listboxes are missing labels in examples
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The purpose of a `listbox` that contains the chips must be conveyed to screen reader users.

#### What is the current behavior?
The purpose of listboxes in the `mat-chip` examples are not conveyed to screen reader users.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [chips example](https://material.angular.io/components/chips/examples)
3. Navigate to the first chip in the 'basic chips' example
   - In NVDA you can press the tab key until you reach the chip
   - In VoiceOver for iOS you can swipe right until you reach the chip
4. Observe that a label was not announced for the group of listbox options.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The documentation for chips states the following:

> The chip input should have a placeholder or be given a meaningful label via `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby`

The [ARIA spec for the `listbox` role](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/#listbox) states that the author is required to provide an accessible name, which can be achieved via `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-chip listboxes are missing labels in examples" (#15010)

Issues.Title: bug(datepicker) wrong rendering with ng-template inside mat-form-field
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
I expected to get the right rendering when using a `matDatepicker` inside a `ng-template`, inside a `mat-form-field`.

#### What is the current behavior?
But currently, the size and the position of the `mat-datepicker-toggle` button are wrong. Inspecting the html, it seems like that, in this case, the component is not moving the `mat-datepicker-toggle` button inside the `mat-form-field-suffix` element.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://angular-material2-issue-putyxt.stackblitz.io

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-putyxt?file=app%2Fapp.component.html


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
OS: Windows 7
Angular: Latest
Angular Material: Latest

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Why I'm doing this?
I'm trying to create a component where the form is dinamically rendered depending by a configuration.
To get this result I'm using an `ngFor` in the `mat-form-field` element and then I'm adding the specific input type inside the element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(datepicker) wrong rendering with ng-template inside mat-form-field" (#15009)

Issues.Title: Feature request: MatTabGroup#focusFirst or MatTab#focus method
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
I would like to be able to programatically set focus on the first tab in an template-referenced exported Material Tab Group instance, much like the focus method on MatListOption#focus. or MatMenu#focusFirstItem

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
It's very "nice to have", but it would make the available API consistent with other Material Components that has focus methods.
Any available focus method is helpful in avoiding document queries. Code feels cleaner without them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature request: MatTabGroup#focusFirst or MatTab#focus method" (#15007)

Issues.Title: expose `addThemeStyleToTarget` method from schematics
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
It would be great if `addThemeStyleToTarget` method can be exposed so that it can be reused. (https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/master/src/lib/schematics/ng-add/theming/theming.ts#L103)

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
I am writing a schematic which involves adding `theme.scss` to a project. I found this method pretty useful and IMO, it is generic enough to be exposed.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "expose `addThemeStyleToTarget` method from schematics" (#15006)

Issues.Title: mat-chip-remove button is not keyboard accessible
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The button to remove a `mat-chip` should be:
1. keyboard operable
2. have a name and role (be a button)

#### What is the current behavior?
The button to remove a `mat-chip` is not:
1. keyboard operable
2. have a name and role (be a button)

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
2. Open the [mat-chip example](https://material.angular.io/components/chips/examples)
3. Press the `tab` key until you reach the 'Lemon' chip under the 'Chips Autocomplete' example.
4. Press the `tab` key again. Observe that the button to remove the chip did not receive focus and that the button to remove the chip does not have an accessible name or role.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
It is possible to remove a chip by pressing backspace. However, I have found that most users are not aware of that behavior. People who use a mouse have access to another (more obvious) way to remove a chip (by clicking the button to remove it), and keyboard-only users should have the same opportunity.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-chip-remove button is not keyboard accessible" (#15005)

Issues.Title: The exclusive selection button toggle example does not convey correct semantics
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
The exclusive button toggle example should convey to screen reader users that:
1. there are many buttons in the same group
2. only one option can be selected at a time

#### What is the current behavior?
The exclusive button toggle example does not convey to screen reader users that
1. there are many buttons in the same group
2. only one option can be selected at a time

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [exclusive selection button example](https://material.angular.io/components/button-toggle/examples)
3. Press tab until you reach one of the toggle buttons
4. Observe that the button does not convey a group label or the fact that only one option can be selected at a time.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?

This is a fairly complex component, so it is important to address the various possible configurations. The solution to this issue depends on the component's configuration.

##### single `mat-button-toggle`

This is a single on/off toggle button. This configuration appears to surface the correct semantics.

See the [W3C ARIA authoring practices information on toggle buttons](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices-1.1/#button) for details on suggested toggle button roles, states, properties, and keyboard interaction.

##### exclusive selection for `mat-button-toggle-group`

From the documentation:

> By default, `mat-button-toggle-group` acts like a radio-button group - only one item can be selected.

Because this configuration functions as a radio button group, radio button group semantics must be surfaced. Without these semantics, screen reader users may not know that:

1. The radio buttons are part of a group
2. The group label for the radio buttons
3. That only one radio button in the group can be selected at a time

See the [W3C ARIA authoring practices information on radio groups](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices-1.1/#radiobutton) for details on suggested toggle button roles, states, properties, and keyboard interaction.

##### multiple selection for `mat-button-toggle-group`

From the documentation:

> Adding the `multiple` attribute allows multiple items to be selected (checkbox behavior)

Because this configuration functions as a checkbox group, checkbox group semantics must be surfaced. Without these semantics, screen reader users may not know that:

1. The checkboxes are part of a group
2. The group label for the checkboxes
3. That many checkboxes in the group can be checked at a time

See the [W3C ARIA authoring practices information on checkboxes](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices-1.1/#checkbox) for details on suggested toggle button roles, states, properties, and keyboard interaction.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The exclusive selection button toggle example does not convey correct semantics " (#15004)

Issues.Title: Toggle buttons in the toggle button example are missing accessible names
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
All toggle buttons that contain a `mat-icon` in the example must have an accessible name.

#### What is the current behavior?
All toggle buttons that contain a `mat-icon` in the example do not have an accessible name.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Using either of the following screen readers
   - NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
   - VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari
2. Open the [toggle button example page](https://material.angular.io/components/button-toggle/examples)
3. Press tab until you reach one of the toggle buttons
4. Observe that the button does not have an accessible name. Only the role and state are announced by the screen reader, for example, "toggle button not pressed".

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
- Angular Material Example 7.2.2 located at https://material.angular.io/components/
- NVDA 2018.4.1 + FireFox 64
- VoiceOver for IOS (12.1.3) + Safari (12.1.3)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The documentation for buttons states the following:

> Buttons or links containing only icons (such as `mat-fab`, `mat-mini-fab`, and `mat-icon-button`) should be given a meaningful label via `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby`.

The toggle button examples that contain only icons should be updated to reflect this advice.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Toggle buttons in the toggle button example are missing accessible names" (#14999)
